ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great overview of the U.S.-Russian relations since 1989 with a wide variety of security and development topics.
I will recommend anyone interested in international affairs.

This course is a broad overview of the US-Russia relationship, and can serve as something of an introduction to Russia studies as well as to US foreign policy. I would recommend it as either an introduction or refresher on these subjects.
Take it. You'll learn an incredible amount of information that is highly pertinent to the world today.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am interested in the time period after the Cold War ended until now and the fact is, U.S. Russian Relations have colored almost everything the U.S. has done since the beginning of the Cold War. This class was important to me to better place the U.S. actions in world context.
The course deepens my understanding of US-Russian relations and world politics. It helps me a lot to analyze contemporary Russian foreign policy.
Taught me multiple perspectives on competing issues, and the deeper causes underlying those issues.
